Description: Hollow-cast, copper alloy votive box, also known as relic-box or animal coffin; rectangular case surmounted by an elongated eel with some finely incised details on back, for head and end of tail; small end at the back still sealed; small end at the back open; such case previously contained a mummified eel (possibly its complete body considering the large size of the case), now empty; few small holes due to corrosion; almost complete and general good condition.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Town (Naukratis), House of 'cache of bronzes'
Curator's comments: Several votive boxes for eels were discovered in Naukratis. According to Petrie, the cache of bronzes found in a building located in the southern part of the city provided thirteen of this category of votive boxes (Petrie 1886, 41-42). This specimen originate from this cache that can be dated around the end of the 5th-beginning of the 4th century BC (Masson 2015). It was listed by Petrie as a '1 long case 14 inches [ca. 35.5 cm], with snake'. Eels were particularly associated to the solar god and demiurge Atum (Myśliwiec 1981; Weiss 2012, 267-268). They belong to the type T 5 in the typology of animal bronzes by K. Weiss (Weiss 2012, 720-721, Taf. 40e-g, Typ T 5, esp. Nr. 721-723 from Naukratis). Kessler, D. 1989, Die Heiligen Tiere und der König, Ägypten und Altes Testament 16, 41, Anm. 21. Masson, A. 2015, ‘Cult and Trade. A reflexion on Egyptian metal offerings from Naukratis’, in D. Robinson and F. Goddio (eds), Thonis Heracleion in Context, Oxford Centre for Maritime Archaeology Monograph 8, Oxford, 71-88. Masson, A. forthcoming b, ‘Naukratis: Egyptian offerings in context’, in M. Bergeron and A. Masson (eds), Naukratis in Context: Cults, Sanctuaries and Offerings, Proceedings of the second Naukratis workshop, held at the British Museum 22nd – 23rd June 2013. Myśliwiec, K., ‘Aal oder Schlange? – Atum oder Mereseger?’, Mitteilungen des Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts Abteilung Kairo 37, 1981, 377-382 (see 379, Nr. 4, Tf. 58a-b on this specimen). Petrie, W. M. F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884-5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London, 41-42. Weiss, K. 2012, Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten : Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland, Ägypten und Altes Testament 81, 267-268, 720-721, Taf. 40e-g, Typ T 5 (Nr. 723 for this specimen).
Bibliographic references: Weiss 2012 / Ägyptische Tier- und Götterbronzen aus Unterägypten : Untersuchungen zu Typus, Ikonographie und Funktion sowie der Bedeutung innerhalb der Kulturkontakte zu Griechenland (Typ T 5, Taf. 40h, Nr. 723)
Myśliwiec 1981 / Aal oder Schlange? – Atum oder Mereseger? (379, Nr. 4, Taf. 58a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (MB.073) (phase 2)
Exhibition history: 2016, 19 May-27 Nov, BM exhibition Sunken Treasures
